Princes Retinue Medieval Living History – with have-a-go archery, knights and ladies, combat show and medieval camp.

location_search: Tintern Abbey  Tintern NP16 6SE

title: Tales Of Wales
location_search: Criccieth Castle  LL52 0DP
info: Listen to the old Tales of Wales, stories that were old before Criccieth Castle was even thought of! These are the legends of old Wales: stories of giants, maidens, wizards and dragons; the kind of stories that always begin in English with Once upon a time… and always begin in Welsh with Amser Maith yn ol... The stories will be told in both Welsh and English, and are suitable for all ages, from 4 to 104!
name: Cadw

title: Easter Fun
location_search: Rhuddlan Castle  LL18 5AD
info: Come and join us for Easter fun at Rhuddlan Castle! Hear local legends brought to life with music by musician and published author, Mair Tomos Ifans. Take part in an Easter Quest and decorate a biscuit. The first 100 children to come in get a free Easter egg!

info: Discover a day in the life of the Tretower household – see the differences between now and then! location_search: Blaenavon Ironworks  North St  Blaenavon NP4 9RN
info: No one can delight and disgust quite like the Ragged Victorians, portraying the daily life of the Victorian poor and industrial workers! From Peelers to rat-catchers to bare knuckle fighters, this is the real 1800s!

title: Resting At The Abbey During The Wars Of The Roses – 1471
location_search: Tintern Abbey  Tintern NP16 6SE
info: Mercenary archers are encamped at the abbey with their families! Why are they there? How do they survive these troubled times? 1471. A company of archers and their families rest at the abbey in order to pay their respects to William Herbert, Earl of Pembroke. They set up camp in the grounds and continue to practise their civilian skills – such as fletching, spinning, dyeing, cooking, leather working and rush weaving and, of course, recreation in the Tavern Tent. One can even write!
name: Cadw

title: Brother Thomas The Cellarer
location_search: Tintern Abbey  Tintern NP16 6SE
info: Step back in time with Brother Thomas and learn what life was like as a monk in Tintern Abbey. Our sympathetic brother will give you inside information about the monks' rituals and responsibilities. As the cellarer of Tintern Abbey, Brother Thomas (a Cistercian monk) will be able to tell you all there is to know (and perhaps some things you shouldn't know!) about the workings of the abbey, his fellow monks, the lay brothers and other ‘less religious' people!
name: Cadw

info: Join the Red Dragon Garrison in a quest to become Castle Squires.   How to visit •    purchase your admission tickets on arrival (or book online)* •    check event times and prices below

title: May Day Madness
location_search: Castell Coch  Cardiff CF15 7JS

title: The Freemen Of Gwent
location_search: Harlech LL46 2YH
info: Come and join us on a journey back in time! name: Cadw

title: Pirate Weekend
location_search: Conwy Castle  LL32 8AY
info: Come to Conwy and see the pirates storm the castle to try and take a prisoner! Can the militia defend the castle and keep it safe? With cannons and gun fire, who will prevail! Conwy Pirate Weekend sees the castle under fire from the pirates docked on the quay. Who will win the battle? Will the red coats defend all inside the castle, through the cloud of black smoke from the gun fire and cannon shots? Or will the pirates take over and escape with a prisoner, and then sail off into the sunset?

location_search: Harlech LL46 2YH
info: Living history in the castle - thrilling, educational and entertaining! name: Cadw

title: Tales And Music With Geoffrey Of Monmouth
location_search: Chepstow Castle  Bridge St  Chepstow NP16 5EY
info: Geoffrey of Monmouth was born in the Norman Welsh Marches towards the end of the 11th century. A Benedictine monk, he was a master storyteller who shaped the medieval idea of British history - including the tales of King Arthur! Come to Chepstow Castle to hear more of Geoffrey's History of the Kings of Britain, plus sweet medieval music from Trouvere. Performances throughout the day.
name: Cadw

title: Birds Of Prey
location_search: Laugharne Castle  SA33 4FA
info: Come and see our falconry event!  And learn about these magnificent birds of prey. A range of species will be on display.  Speak to the experts, and enjoy the birds' flying displays at 12pm and 3pm.  A great day out for the whole family!   How to visit
name: Cadw

info: Join us at the Baths to find the Roman Caesars hiding here! They've been at the Baths for nearly 2000 years, so you'll have to work hard to figure out where they're hidden!   How to visit •    purchase your admission tickets on arrival (or book online)* •    check event times and prices below

title: Men At Arms

name: Cadw

title: The Pilgrimage
location_search: Tintern Abbey  Tintern NP16 6SE
info: The year is 1416, and the Freemen of Gwent have returned from France where they fought victoriously under King Henry V's banner at Agincourt the previous year. However, they feel the need to atone for their sins to save themselves from dire retribution, and what better place to achieve this than at Tintern Abbey, on their home doorstep.
name: Cadw

title: Carmarthenshire Falconry
location_search: Kidwelly Castle  SA17 5BQ
info: Falconry goes back over the centuries; it's believed it started as a way of catching food to eat.  This is still at the core of Carmarthenshire Falconry, together with conservation. This falconry event explains about the different birds and how they were used back in medieval times, and offers an opportunity to hold the birds as well.   How to visit
name: Cadw

title: Guided Tour
location_search: Criccieth Castle  LL52 0DP
info: Take a tour with guide Deian ap Rhisiart and discover the secrets of the castle that was originally built by Llywelyn the Great. The castle changed hands regularly between the Welsh and the English: can you imagine how dangerous and unstable the medieval times were, as war cast a constant shadow on the inhabitants? Step back in time as we follow in the footsteps of the Welsh soldiers who tried to capture the castle. Blood and dignity, passion and grandeur, all were prominent in the history of th...

title: Excavating Medieval Castell Coch: A Victorian Expedition
location_search: Castell Coch  Cardiff CF15 7JS
info: Castell Coch is a Victorian rebuild in its upper levels, whilst being on Medieval lower levels and foundations. Before this re-build took place a series of archaeological excavations were conducted by a G.T.Clark, whose work was published in 1850. Join us in reconstructing the Victorian excavations here of the 1800s. Uncover with your own hands a range of Medieval treasures, try and guess what it is you have found!
